trans-unit.source: Specifies how numbers in text are displayed in different cultures.
Most cultures use the decimal system to represent numbers, but many cultures use different digit shapes.
The following table shows several numbering systems used by different cultures.
![Table of number substitution glyphs](~/add/media/numbersubstitution01.png "Table of number substitution glyphs")
Example of the appearance of digits in different cultures
It is not sufficient to provide alternate Unicode code points for each set of digit shapes, because, unlike letters, digits are used in calculations.
Every application, every operating system, and every run-time library contains code dedicated to converting an internal binary format numeric value to a string of characters, and vice versa.
These conversion routines are coded to use Unicode digits "0030" through "0039".
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution> class provides functionality that allows different cultures to substitute the appropriate digit shapes at rendering time.
This functionality is similar to the one used for providing font substitution and language dependent font rendering.

Many cultures are discarding their traditional digits shapes and adopting Western digits shapes, therefore the number substitution functionality recognizes the distinction for each culture between traditional digit shapes and national standard digit shapes.
XAML Text Usage
This type is not typically used in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] as an object element.
However, the type exposes several attached properties that can be set on other object elements that have text content.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution"></xref> class with explicit property values.
Identifies the source of the culture value that is used to determine number substitution.

Identifies which culture to use when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureSource"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberCultureSource.Override"></xref>.
Identifies the substitution method that is used to determine number substitution.

Gets or sets a value which identifies which culture to use when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureSource"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberCultureSource.Override"></xref>.
The default value of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureSource%2A> property is `null`, which is interpreted as the "en-us" (United States English) culture.
If <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureSource%2A> is not set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberCultureSource.Override>, this property is ignored.
This reference page represents two identically named but not entirely equivalent usages for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureOverride%2A> property:
You can set this property in code on a <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution> instance, as a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] property.
In this usage, the property is not backed by a dependency property identifier, it is backed by a private field and does not act as a dependency property.
You can set this property as an attached property usage in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].
The attached property usage is the reason why this property has a Dependency Property Information section, because the attached property is backed by a dependency property identifier.

In [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], the usage is `<`*object* **NumberSubstitution.CultureOverride**`="`*value*`".../>`, where *object* is an object element where the specified number substitution logic applies, and *value* is one of the string-format values as explained in XAML Values.
In code, the attached property usage is supported by <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.GetCultureOverride%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.SetCultureOverride%2A>.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*CultureInfo*
String representation of a <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> value.
For example, the string, "en-us", represents the United States English culture setting.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> value that represents the culture that is used as an override.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureOverride"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value which identifies the source of the culture value that is used to determine number substitution.
The default value of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureSource%2A> property is <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberCultureSource.Text>, which is the culture of the text run.
This reference page represents two identically named but not entirely equivalent usages for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureSource%2A> property:
You can set this property in code on a <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution> instance, as a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] property.
In this usage, the property is not backed by a dependency property identifier, it is backed by a private field and does not act as a dependency property.
You can set this property as an attached property usage in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].
The attached property usage is the reason why this property has a Dependency Property Information section, because the attached property is backed by a dependency property identifier.

In [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], the usage is `<`*object* **NumberSubstitution.CultureSource**`="`*value*`".../>`, where *object* is an object element where the specified number substitution logic applies, and *value* is a string representation of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberCultureSource> value.
In code, the attached property usage is supported by <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.GetCultureSource%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.SetCultureSource%2A>.
XAML Attribute Usage
\<*object* **NumberSubstitution.CultureSource**="<xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberCultureSource>"/>
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
An enumerated value of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberCultureSource"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureSource"></xref> dependency property.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution"></xref> object.
Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution> objects are equal if the following properties are equal:
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution"></xref> object.
`true` if o is equal to the current object; otherwise, `false`.
If o is not a object, `false` is returned.
Returns the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureOverride"></xref> from the provided element.
The element to return a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureOverride"></xref> value for.
A <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> value that represents the culture that is used as an override.
Returns the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureSource"></xref> from the provided element.
The element to return a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureSource"></xref> value for.
An enumerated value of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberCultureSource"></xref>.
Serves as a hash function for <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution"></xref>.
It is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> value that represents the hash code for the current object.
Returns the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.Substitution"></xref> from the provided element.
The element to return a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.Substitution"></xref> value for.
An enumerated value of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod"></xref>.
Sets the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureOverride"></xref> for a provided element.
Element that is specifying a culture override.
A culture override value of type <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref>.
Sets the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureSource"></xref> for a provided element.
Element that is specifying a culture override.
A culture source value of type <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberCultureSource"></xref>.
Sets the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.Substitution"></xref> for a provided element.
Element that is specifying a substitution method.
A substitution method value of type <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value which identifies the substitution method that is used to determine number substitution.

The default value of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.CultureSource%2A> property is <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod.AsCulture>, which specifies that the substitution method should be determined based on the number culture's <xref:System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.DigitSubstitution%2A> property value.
This reference page represents two identically named but not entirely equivalent usages for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.Substitution%2A> property:
You can set this property in code on a <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution> instance, as a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] property.
In this usage, the property is not backed by a dependency property identifier, it is backed by a private field and does not act as a dependency property.
You can set this property as an attached property usage in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].
The attached property usage is the reason why this property has a Dependency Property Information section, because the attached property is backed by a dependency property identifier.

In [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], the usage is `<`*object* **NumberSubstitution.Substitution**`="`*value*`".../>`, where *object* is an object element where the specified number substitution logic applies, and *value* is a string representation of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod> value.
In code, the attached property usage is supported by <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.GetSubstitution%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.SetSubstitution%2A>.
XAML Attribute Usage
\<*object* **NumberSubstitution.Substitution**="<xref:System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod>"/>
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
An enumerated value of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitution.Substitution"></xref> dependency property.
